sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都含"决定"之意。
means: decide ： 侧重指经过思考、比较、讨论或询问之后做出的决定。
determine ： 指经过深思熟虑，决心去做某事并坚持施行。
resolve ： 语气较强，强调以坚定不移的信念去做或不做某事，暗含有远大抱负和坚强决心。
settle ： 指排除犹豫、怀疑和争论之后作出明确的最终结论。

sentence.Network_en: A dentist may decide to extract the tooth to prevent recurrent trouble.
sentence.Network_cn: 牙医可能会决定拔掉那颗牙，以免反复发作。

sentence.Network_en: He might decide that it is best to induce labour.
If the clubs cannot conclude a deal, an independent tribunal will decide.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果俱乐部之间无法达成协议，将由一个独立的仲裁委员会来裁定。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'bring to a settlement'): from French décider, from Latin decidere 'determine', from de- 'off' + caedere 'cut'

encyclopedia.content: decide 英[di'said]美[di'said] v. 1.下决心；锛埵癸級决定 2.解决，裁决，肯定，断定，判决 v.[T] 1.对…作出抉择；决定；选定 2.影响（或决定）…的结果 3.成为（某人）做某事的原因 v. 1.下决心；锛埵癸級决定 2.解决，裁决，肯定，断定，判决 v.[T] 1.对…作出抉择；决定；选定 2.影响（或决定）…的结果 3.成为（某人）做某事的原因 时 态：decided,deciding,decides 名 词：decid'er 形容词：decid'able 同反义词 词义辨析

entry.def: If you decide to do something, you choose to do it, usually after you have thought carefully about the other possibilities.

example.ex: She decided to do a secretarial course...
example.tran: 她决定修一门文秘课程。

example.ex: He has decided that he doesn't want to embarrass the movement and will therefore step down...
example.tran: 他已拿定主意：他不想令运动陷入困窘的境地，因此决心辞职。

entry.def: If a person or group of people decides something, they choose what something should be like or how a particular problem should be solved.

example.ex: She was still young, he said, and that would be taken into account when deciding her sentence...
example.tran: 他说，她还年轻，而这一点在对她量刑时将会予以考虑。

example.ex: This is an issue that should be decided by local and metropolitan government.
example.tran: 这个问题应该由当地及大都市政府共同解决。

entry.tran: （事件或事实）决定，确定（某一选择或结果)
entry.def: If an event or fact decides something, it makes it certain that a particular choice will be made or that there will be a particular result.

example.ex: The goal that decided the match came just before the interval...
example.tran: 决定本场比赛结果的进球是在中场休息前一刻打入的。

example.ex: The results will decide if he will win a place at a good university...
example.tran: 这些成绩将决定他能否上一所好大学。

entry.def: If you decide that something is true, you form that opinion about it after considering the facts.

example.ex: He decided Franklin must be suffering from a bad cold...
example.tran: 他断定富兰克林一定是得了重感冒。

example.ex: I couldn't decide whether he was incredibly brave or just insane.
example.tran: 我不能判定他到底是英勇无畏还是精神失常。

entry.def: If something decides you to do something, it is the reason that causes you to choose to do it.

example.ex: The banning of his play decided him to write about censorship...
example.tran: 他的戏剧被禁演，这促使他下定决心就审查制度的问题下笔。

example.ex: I don't know what finally decided her, but she agreed.
example.tran: 我不知道是什么让她最终拿定了主意，但她还是同意了。

means.word_mean: 1. reach, make, or come to a decision about something;
2. bring to an end; settle conclusively;

sentences.sentence: "The judge decided the case in favor of the plaintiff"
"The father adjudicated when the sons were quarreling over their inheritance"
"The vote in New Hampshire often decides the outcome of the Presidential election"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: How did you decide which services to link to?

stems_affixes.word_buile: insect昆虫+cide切开,杀→杀虫的[东西]

Sentence.sentence: Second, Americans have basically decided that they don't really want to produce all their own oil.
Third, decide on your own system for marking.
They have the right to decide on changes
The man has decided to quit his computer class
The fine points of the law are decided by the courts and by acceptable common practice overtime
An influential figure decided to move from the countryside to the city.

sentences.en: You are the one to decide.

means.word_mean: 解决, 裁决, 肯定, 断定，判决

sentences.en: He decided that she couldn't pass the examination this time.
sentences.cn: 他断定这次考试她不会及格。

jushi.chinese: 有决定权的是那些金融家们。

jushi.english: I have been waiting all day for them to decide.
jushi.chinese: 我整天都在等待他们作出决定。

jushi.english: It is for you to decide.
